ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a great course. Very clear and interesting.
I totally recommend this class even for students who don't need this course for their research because it was very fun and broaden your physics knowledge.

I would recommend this course to students planning to work in this field (gravity, cosmology, astrophysics) and are sure they are going to need it. Otherwise it is quite a demanding course about concepts not used as much in other fields.
I would certainly recommend this course who has an interest on the subject and lots of spare time!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course is important for my understanding of classical gravity, field theory in general, and some mathematical topics. It is also a good introduction to basic ideas in cosmology. It is not directly relavent to research now. But I'm sure it will be in future.
A good treatment of general relativity would help anyone's research!
